record.text: Congrats / so sorry / congrats! I hope you have some rewards picked out for yourself.

Getting one conditional accept and one desk reject back-to-back for two articles from the same project is a real emotional ride. Reminding myself and everyone else to celebrate the wins when they come, and also rejection is normal and fine and worth celebrating too (thx @mirya.bsky.social for that)

record.text: I was going to make a Sonny Bono/Q-Tip (hip-hop artist) joke about representation, but I figured I’d be the fiftieth guy to do so
writing a column and i keep writing “Jim Jones” — as in the rapper — instead of “Jim Jordan” and now i can’t help but think of what the House would be like with a few members of Dipset hanging around
i should have figured that everyone would want to talk jonestown instead of playing around with my joke

Yet another example of why armed police shouldn't be the default response to calls for help: a woman called 911 because she was having trouble calming down her autistic teenage son. A group of cops came to her apartment, refused to put on masks, beat up her boyfriend for insisting, & arrested him.

Breaking: A federal court has chosen a new congressional map (shown on the right below) to impose in Alabama that creates a second district for Black voters under the Voting Rights Act.

It will likely mean a Black Democrat replaces a white Republican after 2024 www.dailykos.com/stories/2023...

images.alt: Graphic comparing the Alabama GOP's invalidated congressional gerrymander and the new court-adopted map that creates a second district for Black voters to elect their preferred candidate in 2024.
Graphic comparing the Alabama GOP's invalidated congressional gerrymander and the new court-adopted map that creates a second district for Black voters to elect their preferred candidate in 2024.

record.text:
Alabama's new congressional map is a result of the Supreme Court unexpectedly upholding a key part of the Voting Rights Act in a landmark ruling this past June.

The GOP has since dropped their appeals for 2024, clearing the way for Alabama to have two Black House members for the first time ever

Breaking: A federal court has chosen a new congressional map (shown on the right below) to impose in Alabama that creates a second district for Black voters under the Voting Rights Act.

It will likely mean a Black Democrat replaces a white Republican after 2024 www.dailykos.com/stories/2023...

images.alt: Graphic comparing the Alabama GOP's invalidated congressional gerrymander and the new court-adopted map that creates a second district for Black voters to elect their preferred candidate in 2024.
Graphic comparing the Alabama GOP's invalidated congressional gerrymander and the new court-adopted map that creates a second district for Black voters to elect their preferred candidate in 2024.

record.text:
The court-adopted congressional map turns Alabama's 2nd District from a solidly GOP seat into one that has a 49-44 Black plurality & backed Joe Biden 56-43 in 2020, making it a top pickup opportunity for Dems in 2024.

See the interactive version here davesredistricting.org/join/f446571...

Earlier this year, the North Carolina Supreme Court's new Republican majority cleared the way for Republicans to re-gerrymander NC & restrict voting access to cement their supermajorities in 2024.

GOP lawmakers are now boosting the party's hold on the courts in a vicious cycle of democratic erosion

record.text:
NEW: North Carolina GOP's new budget became law this week & contains power grabs to boost GOP control over NC's courts & elections.

One part expands GOP control over a commission they're using to target NC's only Black Supreme Court justice after she criticized the court system's lack of diversity

record.text:
North Carolina GOP's new budget guts public records requirements, letting lawmakers conceal a wide range of documents even after they've left office.

It ends a requirement that most documents & communications related to redistricting become public records just before the GOP passes new gerrymanders

record.text:
North Carolina Republicans also raised the mandatory retirement age for state judges from 72 to 76 so the powerful GOP chief justice can serve up to 4 more years.

The change means Democrats couldn’t appoint a Dem as chief justice in 2027 if they win the 2024 election for governor

value.text: The DeSantis campaign has helpfully reported gas prices through 2029.

record.text: A conversation no one really wants to have & that is complicated by downstream impacts of rising fuel costs is that gas has probably been priced way too low, given the climate related costs we haven’t built into the pricing, for years. It’s not an unambiguously bad thing for it to be rising now.
even more helpfully, they've let us know Joe Biden will be re-elected. that's a relief!

record.text: the thing about this dynamic is it applies to any city-exurb relationship. conservatives in central virginia talk about charlottesville and richmond as if they were total hellholes

value.text: most conservatives have a strong suspicion that the sterile exurban communities they've chosen to live in suck and America's cities are full of people doing fun, exciting and sexy stuff, so there's naturally an enormous appetite among them for stories about city dwellers being violently punished

record.text:
Here as well now and realized the pain of searching for all the great people I follow on Twitter... I also realized that my network consists of much more men than women! 

Can you help me find all these great female political scientists out here? -->
yes indeed--the google sheet for media appearances (and LoRs) is a timesaver
The best, most annoying advice I have is to enter things into your annual report as they're accomplished.

I use a Google Sheet that's always open and add things as I do them.  I also use the CONCATENATE function to generate complete sentences about my press appearances that I can copy and paste into my report, which saves a lot of time.

images.alt: Spreadsheet containing data for an annual report.
Spreadsheet containing data for an annual report.

record.text: There are nine polisky workshops across all subfields, including teaching and policy-focused workshops. Use this an excuse to reach out to cool people you've wanted to work on a project with! The deadline to apply is Thursday, 10/19 at 11:59pm PT.

record.text: Basically, hosting whatever format of event you want that will provide a strong basis for your future polisky collaborative research, teaching, policy, etc. efforts. We are open to a range of common research projects like:
